Monument.Name: Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque Center, Abu Dhabi
Monument.Description: An absolute gem of the modern world, Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque Center may have only been completed in 2007, but it has already garnered much media attention (remember that controversial photograph of Rihanna posing in front of it? Yeah, you do). It's wonders include 82 domes of seven different sizes and a library pregnant with classic Islamic books and publications.Pro tip: This is a place of worship, so be respectful and follow custom or you may end up like Rihanna and be asked to leave the premises.

Type.Name: Triumphal arch
Type.Description: Almost always to commemorate military successes

Tag.Description: Carved from pure marble

Monument.Name: St Peter's Basilica, Italy
Monument.Description: According to Catholicism, St Peter's Basilica houses the body of the disciple, St Peter, who is also known as the guardian of the gates to heaven. As an architectural piece, it is majestic, the domes stretch high above and may be climbed all the way, or can be accessed (half the way) via elevator.Pro tip: Arrive in the early afternoon, this way you avoid the tour group crowds, or you may be in line for a while.

Type.Name: Triumphal arch
Type.Description: Almost always to commemorate military successes

Tag.Description: Heave bronze work surviving the test of time with honour
Heavy bronze work

Monument.Name: Mezquita Catedral de Cordoba, Spain
Monument.Description: Instantly Insta-worthy and candy for the eyes, the Mezquita Catedral de Cordoba is a heady mix of Gothic and Islamic architecture.The architecture reflects its history, having served as both an Islamic mosque and a Catholic cathedral.

Type.Name: Gravestone
Type.Description: Small monuments to the deceased, placed at their gravesites

Tag.Description: Heavy bronze work

Monument.Name: Taj Mahal, India
Monument.Description: A constant on the Seven Wonders of World lists, the Taj Mahal is so highly acclaimed that one TripAdvisor user has been bold enough to claim that "you haven't lived until you've visited it." Built in 1632, the white marble mausoleum houses the tomb of the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan's favourite wife, Mumtaz Mahal.

Type.Name: Palace
Type.Description: Imposing royal residences designed to impress people with their grandeur and greatness

Tag.Description: Carved from pure marble

Monument.Name: Milan Cathedral, Italy
Monument.Description: Milan may be the capital of Italian fashion, but it also holds a capital "duomo" Cathedral in its square. An immense construction, it's best viewed and photographed on the outside with its brilliant white facade leaving you absolutely flawed. Make sure you make the climb up to the top of the Cathedral for pristine views over the city.Pro tip: Be careful in the square / forecourt: there are pigeons EVERYWHERE.

Type.Name: Mausoleum or tomb
Type.Description: Honors the dead

Tag.Description: Simple and effective, massive and powerful

Monument.Name: Alcatraz, USA
Monument.Description: The infamous prison island off the coast of San Francisco is an undisputed "must visit" when in San Fran. It's a completely alternate feeling from the other winners on this list, harbouring a more eerie and haunted atmosphere. Its journeyed from being a military garrison to a military prison to being the home of Native American activists and now remains abandoned and open for tourists.

Type.Name: Gravestone
Type.Description: Small monuments to the deceased, placed at their gravesites

Tag.Description: Simple and effective, massive and powerful

Monument.Name: Hungarian Parliament Building, Hungary
Monument.Description: No landmark commands the waterfront the way the Hungarian Parliament Building in Budapest does.Opened in 1904, this century-old site still stands strong as the seat of the National Assembly of Hungary. It takes tourists on guided tours to marvel at its Neo-Gothic architecture and the historical relics that lie within, including the Hungarian Crown Jewels.

Type.Name: Church monument
Type.Description: To commemorate the faithful dead, located above or near their grave, often featuring an effigy

Tag.Description: Refined iron, indicator of rich war winners

Monument.Name: Golden Gate Bridge, San Francisco
Monument.Description: Another San Fran entrant and the only other bridge to have beaten our Sydney Harbour Bridge, the Golden Gate Bridge is named so as it spans the Golden Gate strait, connecting the city to Marin County. A symbol of the city, what makes this suspension bridge so exceptional are its eye-catching colours, impressive pillars (750ft) and magical views.

Type.Name: Temple
Type.Description: Religious structures built for pilgrimage, ritual or commemorative purposes

Tag.Description: Hard metal material used during war periods

Monument.Name: StaromEstske NamEsti, Czech Republic
Monument.Description: Otherwise known as the Old Town Square in Prague, this historical space is a magnet for history lovers. Moments from the famous Charles Bridge, it features the Prague Orloj astronomical clock, the Old Town Hall and the Gothic Church of Our Lady before Tyn.Pro tip: Visit over Christmas to see the area lit up in Christmas Market fair.

Type.Name: Fountain
Type.Description: Water-pouring structures usually placed in formal gardens or town squares

Tag.Description: Creation of modern times, non-conventional material, indicator of a spiritually embraced artist

Monument.Name: Notre Dame Cathedral, France
Monument.Description: French for "Our Lady of Paris" (Notre-Dame de Paris), this building has been hailed as being one of the finest examples of French Gothic architecture. From sculptures to stained glass it can be studied for hours by the curious mind and, like many other churches and cathedrals, you are able to climb up its towers for a close-up view of its bells and gargoyles.Pro tip: Approach it from the bridge to make the journey that much more spectacular.

Type.Name: Terminating vista
Type.Description: Layout design for urban monuments on the end of an avenue

Tag.Description: Simple and effective, massive and powerful

Monument.Name: Corcovado - Cristo Redeemer, Brazil
Monument.Description: Watching over the city of Rio de Janeiro, is a giant statue of Christ the Redeemer who stands at an impressive 30 metres, which doesn't include its 8 metre pedestal. Second only to its panoramic views of the city which include Sugar Loaf Mountain. Originally designed as a statue of Christ holding a globe, it now features Christ opening his arms to embrace the world instead.Pro tip: If you're travelling during winter, ensure the day of your trip is not a rainy one or you'll hardly be able to see the statue, let alone the view.

Type.Name: Column
Type.Description: Often topped with a statue

Tag.Description: Carved from pure marble
Hard metal material used during war periods

Monument.Name: Eiffel Tower, France
Monument.Description: The iconic symbol of France is visited by millions yearly and is unsurprisingly the most visited monument in Paris. Originally criticised when it was first erected in 1889 for its design, more than 100 years on it stand synonymous with the city. Guess it's Alexandre Gustave Eiffel (designer) who is laughing now, haw haw haw.Pro tip: Climb the tower if you wish, but for that picture perfect photo, your best bet is on the green of the Champ de Mars park which is stands inside.

Type.Name: Statue
Type.Description: Usually statue of famous individuals or symbols

Tag.Description: Carved from pure blacked marbe, rarest mineral in Africa

Monument.Name: Tower of London, UK
Monument.Description: Perched on the edge of the water not a moments walk from Tower Bridge, Tower of London is steeped in history that many would know full well. William The Conqueror, Henry III, and Edward I all played parts in its creation, Henry VI was murdered here and Anne Boleyn lived here.Today the crown jewels can be seen within its walls.Pro tip: Score 2 for 1 tickets with a valid train ticket. With tickets costing �30.30 per person, if two are travelling you can catch the train here (a one-stop journey will do). Then, show your ticket at the ticket booth to get you both in for the price of one.

Type.Name: Column
Type.Description: Often topped with a statue

Tag.Description: Carved from pure blacked marbe, rarest mineral in Africa
Carved from pure marble

Monument.Name: The Acropolis, Greece
Monument.Description: No visit to Athens would be complete without taking in the magnanimity of the Acropolis.Perched high above the city, it's pretty difficult not to spot this ancient citadel. This incredible architectural feat is home to the famous Parthenon as well as the Temple of Athena NikePro tip: The lines at the base of The Acropolis always run long but if you're planning to visit multiple sites, you can purchase a multi-site pass from a ticket booth at a participating archaeological site including Ancient Agora, Roman Agora and Hadrian's Library) which typically have short or no line.

Type.Name: Palace
Type.Description: Imposing royal residences designed to impress people with their grandeur and greatness

Tag.Description: Heave bronze work surviving the test of time with honour
Simple and effective, massive and powerful

Monument.Name: Great Wall of Mutianyu, China
Monument.Description: Not the Great Wall itself, but rather a section of it that lies in Huairou County, a short distance away from the city of Beijing. What makes this section in particular so significant? Aside from connecting Jianjou and Lianhuachi, it's one of the best preserved sections of the Wall itself and sits almost completely surrounded by forest.

Type.Name: Mound
Type.Description: Erected to commemorate great leaders or events

Tag.Description: Creation of modern times, non-conventional material, indicator of a spiritually embraced artist

Monument.Name: Temple of the Reclining Buddha (Wat Pho), Thailand
Monument.Description: One of the three major temples in Thailand's capital, while all are spectacular in their own way, the Temple of the Reclining Buddha commands attention measuring 15 metres in height and 43 metres in length. Its most impressive feature however is its feet, which are inlaid with mother-of-pearl comprising of 108 individual panels each symbolising various aspects of Buddha.Pro tip: Don't limit yourself to Wat Pho, dedicate a whole day to the temples. You won't regret it.

Type.Name: Mausoleum or tomb
Type.Description: Honors the dead

Tag.Description: Carved from pure marble

Monument.Name: Burj Khalifa, UAE
Monument.Description: Welcome the tallest building in the world (to date). Standing at 828.8 metres tall (what a number), Burf Khalifa was constructed in 2004 and sits in Downtown Dubai. And if you're having problems seeing it, there must be something wrong with your eyes because it stands out like crazy.Pro tip: Get in early (before 5pm) for less crowds and less moolah. Prime time is 5pm-7:30pm.

Type.Name: Mound
Type.Description: Erected to commemorate great leaders or events

Tag.Description: Heavy bronze work

Monument.Name: Sydney Opera House, Australia
Monument.Description: Woohoo! We made it onto the list. Australia had to pip somewhere and where she does, it's for the Opera House. Brimming with iconic architecture, TripAdvisor users have called it the "Taj Mahal of Oceania". What do you think?Pro tip: Take the stroll around the front of the Opera House for a view of the Sydney Harbour and then continue your walk through the Botanic Gardens for a sunny afternoon out.

Type.Name: Church monument
Type.Description: To commemorate the faithful dead, located above or near their grave, often featuring an effigy

Tag.Description: Carved from pure blacked marbe, rarest mineral in Africa

Monument.Name: El Ateneo Grand Splendid, Argentina
Monument.Description: Image: Buenos Aires CuidadLibrary hound? There's none grander than El Ateneo Grand Splendid.Housed within a former theare/cinema (the Gran Splendid), it retains much of the original architecture, including the dome which is decorated in the artistry of Italian Nazareno Orlandi.

Type.Name: Building
Type.Description: Designed as landmarks, usually built with an extraordinary feature, such being designed as the tallest, largest, or most distinctive design

Tag.Description: Heavy bronze work

Monument.Name: Notre-Dame Basilica, Canada
Monument.Description: We'll give you a moment to pick that jaw off the floor. This basilica is literally that beautiful. You'll find it in the Old Town of Montreal and once you enter you'll feel as though you've been transported to another time and place.Lights sparkle and orchestral music plays in this enchanting space. It features a series of multimedia installations which come to light after dark.

Type.Name: Fountain
Type.Description: Water-pouring structures usually placed in formal gardens or town squares

Tag.Description: Carved from pure marble

Monument.Name: Fushimi Inari-taisha Shrine, Japan
Monument.Description: You'll have crossed paths with this traditional shrine and its maze like torii gates on social media, for sure.Thousands of these gates stack together, building into a network of trails that lead toward the central buildings.While you'll find Inari shrines throughout the country, this one in Kyoto in particular draws the crowds in for its forest trails, views from the summit of Mount Inarii on which is stands, and the beauty of its main buildings.

Type.Name: Church monument
Type.Description: To commemorate the faithful dead, located above or near their grave, often featuring an effigy

Tag.Description: Carved from pure blacked marbe, rarest mineral in Africa
Heave bronze work surviving the test of time with honour

Monument.Name: Shwedagon Pagoda, Myanmar
Monument.Description: Also known as the Great Dagon Pagoda, Shwedagon Pagoda is arguable one of the most famous and iconic pagodas in the world.Standing at 99 metres high on top of a hill, it can be captured from almost everyone in the city of Yangon. It's guided top boasts over 7,000 jewels including diamonds, rubies and sapphires.This is an active Buddhist pagoda which welcomes followers to pray and worship on its grounds daily.

Type.Name: Mosque Monument
Type.Description: Places of worship that generally have domes and minarets that stand out against the skyline. They also usually feature highly skilled Islamic calligraphy and geometric artwork

Tag.Description: Carved from pure blacked marbe, rarest mineral in Africa
Creation of modern times, non-conventional material, indicator of a spiritually embraced artist
